oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Reap the rewards from reseeding
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Clavin, Dan
Fox, Paul
Coyne, Mark
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Pasture and forage crops
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Permanent grass clover leys are a vital component of productive organic grassland farms. In all, there are 3 main ways to re-seed - full reseeding of permanent pastures, under-sowing with a cereal crop and thirdly over-sowing onto an existing sward. In this article aspects of full reseeding of permanent pastures will be discussed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Clavin, Dan; Fox, Paul and Coyne, Mark (2012) Reap the rewards from reseeding. Organic Matters, 2012, pp. 1-13.
